answers.answer: Blackouts aren't a good thing. If your doctor gave you no answers or even any tips on things to try you should either go to another doctor or go to the hospital. It could be something as simple as low blood sugar or iron but could also be gestational diabetes.

Im 36 weeks n this happened to me last week. Go to the ER.. They found out i was dehydrated gave me two liters of fluids thru IVs and my blood pressure was low which caused the dizziness n fainting feeling. I never passed out but was surely close too.

question: For the past month or so I've been experiencing blackouts I went to the doctor for them yesterday and they ran a series of test but today I experienced nausea vomiting and then a fall out twice and I'm not sure if I should go to the emergency room yet I don't want them to just run the same test that my doctor ran and not give me any results I'm very scared I'm 22 weeks pregnant
title: Feeling faint
